message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with cross-lingual sentiment classification using structural correspondence learning. It also involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new method for learning meaningful one-to-many mappings for pivot words using large amounts of monolingual data and a small dictionary. 

It may also be relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as sentiment classification is a common task in information retrieval and the proposed method could be useful in improving cross-lingual sentiment analysis. 

Additionally, it could be relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves machine learning techniques and the development of a new approach for cross-lingual sentiment classification. 

Finally, it could be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as the proposed method involves the use of distributed representations of words, which is a common technique in computer vision and pattern recognition.
